results.name: Stoll's Pharmacy, Inc. COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Stoll's Pharmacy - Waterbury
Address: 185 Grove Street, Waterbury, CT 06710
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can register and schedule an appointment at this location online by clicking here or by calling to schedule an appointment. The minimum age requirement for this clinic is 18. Appointment for 2nd dose is made at the time of administration of 1st dose.
What to Bring: Official State Identification and Insurance Cards

results.name: Bristol Health COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Bristol Hospital
Address: 41 Brewster Rd, Bristol, CT 06010
Hours: M-F: 8am-4pm (Appointment Required)
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS) or they can schedule it by calling 877-918-2224.
  • VAMS: Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about this process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address.
  • Phone: Individuals can schedule an appointment at this location by phone by dialing the CT COVID-19 Vaccine Appointment Assist Line at 877-918-2224.
What to Bring: Vaccine recipients should bring photo ID and insurance information.
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. Vaccine clinic is located on the first floor and is wheelchair accessible.
Additional Information: Free parking is available across the street from the main hospital. Patients should enter the hospital's main entrance and follow signs to the vaccine clinic.
results.eligibility: Ages 16+; healthcare workers and medical first responders; pre-k to 12 school personnel and childcare providers
results.application_process: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS) or they can schedule it by calling 877-918-2224.
results.hours_of_operation: By appointment. Schedule through VAMS or by phone (877-918-2224).
results.site_name: BRISTOL HEALTH - COVID-19 VACCINE CLINIC

site_phones.phone_1_description: CT COVID-19 Vaccine Appt Assist Line

results.name: Pomperaug Health District COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Southbury (PDDH Office)
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Pomperaug Health District
Address:77 Main Street North- Suite 205, Southbury, CT 06488
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Individuals can make an appointment at this location online at the health district's website or by phone.
  • Online: Individuals can visit the health district's website at https://www.pddh.org/programs/covid-19-vaccination.php and click on the link for 'Appointments for People 65 years & Older - at PDDH Office' to book an appointment through the website. New users will be prompted to create an account before they can use the online scheduling system.
  • Phone: Individuals without internet access can call 203-264-9616 (ext. 7) to make an appointment.
  • Second Dose Scheduling: Patients must schedule an appointment for a second dose at the time of their first vaccination.
What to Bring: Insurance card, completed consent form (link in confirmation email or a copy can be picked up at the office)
Access: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. There are ramps into the building and elevator access to the 2nd floor.
Additional Information: Patients should arrive at the clinic 5 minutes ahead of their appointment and plan on being there for 30-45 minutes. There is a 15 minute observation time after receiving the vaccine.
results.eligibility: Ages 16+; healthcare workers and medical first responders; pre-k to 12 school personnel and childcare providers
results.application_process: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can make an appointment at this location online at the health district's website (https://www.pddh.org/programs/covid-19-vaccination.php) or by phone (203-264-9616, ext. 7).
results.hours: Mon A - A; Tue A - A; Wed A - A; Thu A - A; Fri A - A; Sat A - A; Sun A - A;
results.hours_of_operation: By appointment. Schedule online or by phone.

results.name: Hartford Healthcare Medical Group COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Southington
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Hartford Healthcare Medical Group - Southington
Address: 81 Meriden Avenue, 3rd Floor, Southington, CT
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Individuals currently eligible for the vaccine may schedule an appointment at a Hartford Healthcare vaccination clinic through MyChartPLUS. Hartford Healthcare patients with an existing MyChartPLUS account can log into mychartplus.org and click ‘Schedule an Appointment’, which is listed under ‘Visits’ at the top. Eligible individuals without a MyChartPLUS account must first create an account and then they may schedule an appointment. If you'd prefer to schedule your appointment by phone, call the Hartford HealthCare Access Center at 860-827-7690 or toll-free at 833-943-5721. The Access Center is available M-F: 8am-5pm. For questions or assistance with scheduling appointments through MyChartPLUS, please call 860-972-4993.
Access: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles.
Additional Information: Vaccines will be administered in the school gymnasium. The entrance is in the rear of the building.

results.name: Meriden Health Department COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic (Senior Center)
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Meriden Senior Center
Address: 22 West Main Street, Meriden, CT 06451
Hours: Days and times will vary (Appointment Required)
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are available to individuals eligible to receive the vaccine. Individuals do not need to be Meriden residents. To schedule an appointment, individuals should call 203-630-4221 or 203-630-4226. All clinics are held at the Senior Center located at 22 West Main Street, Meriden.
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site where individuals leave their vehicles to enter the vaccine clinic. Location has wheelchair ramps and automatic doors. And, for individuals who cannot safely ambulate into the senior center, a nurse may administer the vaccine to the individual in the vehicle.
Additional Information: This location can serve Spanish and French speakers.

results.name: UCONN Health COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Munson Road
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: UConn Health
Address: 16 Munson Road, Farmington 06032
Access: This is not a drive thru site. Individuals access the vaccination clinic on foot.
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: UCONN Health eligible patients with an existing MyChart account can log into https://mychart.uconn.edu and click on ‘SCHEDULE COVID VACCINE DOSE 1 FOR THOSE ELIGIBLE.' If one is not a current MyChart user, they can sign up for MyChart at https://mychart.uconn.edu. For any MyChart questions or technical difficulties during regular business hours, contact 860-679-4400.
Individuals who need help with scheduling an appointment at this location may call UCONN's dedicated COVID Vaccine Scheduling line at 860-679-5589. For general questions about the vaccine, call the UCONN COVID Vaccine Call Center at 860-679-8888.
What to Bring: Proof of identification and insurance card.
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles.
Additional Information: Individuals that need an interpreter service should notify this site of their language needs when making their appointment. Interpreters are available on site. ADA accommodations at this site include handicap accessible parking, ground level entrance, wheelchair offering, and automatic doors. TTY 860-679-2242

results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: UConn Health - John Dempsey Hospital
Address: 135 Dowling Way, Farmington 06030 (Outpatient Pavilion, 1st Floor)
Access: This is not a drive thru site. Individuals access the vaccination clinic on foot.
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: UCONN Health eligible patients with an existing MyChart account can log into https://mychart.uconn.edu and click on ‘SCHEDULE COVID VACCINE DOSE 1 FOR THOSE ELIGIBLE.' If one is not a current MyChart user, they can sign up for MyChart at https://mychart.uconn.edu. For any MyChart questions or technical difficulties during regular business hours, contact 860-679-4400.
Individuals who need help with scheduling an appointment at this location may call UCONN's dedicated COVID Vaccine Scheduling line at 860-679-5589. For general questions about the vaccine, call the UCONN COVID Vaccine Call Center at 860-679-8888.
What to Bring: Proof of identification and insurance card.
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles.
Additional Information: Individuals that need an interpreter service should notify this site of their language needs when making their appointment. Interpreters are available on site. ADA accommodations at this site include handicap accessible parking, ground level entrance, wheelchair offering, and automatic doors.

results.name: Sanitas Medical Center COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Newington
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Santias Medical Center - Newington
Address: 196 Kitts Lane, Newington, CT 06111
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address. Individuals can call to schedule an appointment at 844-307-4827. Individuals scheduling appointments by phone must make sure to also, schedule second vaccine dose appointment.

results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Wilbur Cross High School
Address: 181 Mitchell Drive, New Haven, CT 06511
Hours: By appointment: Tuesday-Friday: 9am-3:30pm; Walk-Ins: Tuesday-Friday: 10am-2pm
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: New Haven residents only can schedule an appointment at this location by calling 203-871-4179 or 877-918-2224.
What to Bring: As available: Photo ID, insurance card, medication list, allergy list, and EpiPen.
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles.
Additional Information: Individuals should plan for the full appointment time, which includes a 15 minute post-vaccine observation period. If individuals have a history of allergic reactions, please allow for a 30 minute observation stay.

results.name: Community Health Center COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Middletown (Wesleyan Tennis Court Lot) - Drive Thru
results.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Wesleyan Tennis Court Lot - COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
Address: 75 Vine Street, Middletown, CT 06457
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS) or they can schedule it by calling 877-918-2224.
  • VAMS: Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about this process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address.
  • Phone: Individuals can schedule an appointment at this location by phone by dialing the CT COVID-19 Vaccine Appointment Assist Line at 877-918-2224.
  • Consent form needed to be filled out for minor ages 16-17 that are unaccompanied by a parent or guardian. Click on the consent form link http://chc1.co/vaccineminorconsent.
Access: This is a drive thru site requiring individuals to be in a vehicle. Individuals being driven to the site should sit in the rear seat on the driver side so that the provider can vaccinate the left arm, unless they have a need for the right arm to be vaccinated.
What to Bring: Insurance card (if insured)
Additional Information: Individuals will need to remain on site for 15-30 minutes after the vaccine for monitoring.
